2. **William (Alec) Sedra** – Hamnett’s twin brother, a book‑collector who disappeared in Britain and is now in New York. | | **The “doorbell” clue** | Maxwell, the house‑keeper, heard the bell ring **four** times that night: 2 quick rings (masked man enters, then a second person enters) and 2 later rings (one person leaves). This shows only **two people** were inside the house during the murder. | | **The “single‑lens” clue** | A single‑lens fragment was found in the hallway, pointing to Dr. Sedra (Hamnett) as the only person who wears such glasses. | | **The “colour‑blind” test** | In Britain, the investigators asked the man who claimed to be “Hamnet Sedra” to name the colour of a handkerchief and a tie. He answered “blue” and “brown” – colours that were actually green, yellow, white and sapphire blue. This proved he was **not** Hamnett (who is not colour‑blind) but William (who is colour‑blind). | | **The “mustache” clue** | William (the colour‑blind twin) wore a fake mustache that matched the one seen in the house. | | **The “bomb” clue** | A bomb was planted 24 h before the murder to destroy the documents. The bomb was set by a third party who vanished after the job was done. | | **The “donor” clue** | Donohue, an Irishman, was kidnapped by the murderer (or the victim) and later found in a hospital. He claims to have seen a man with a blue hat and a fake mustache – again pointing to William. | | **The “time” clue** | The grandfather clock shows the killer was in the study at 12:24 am, in the bedroom at 12:26 am – the murder time. | | **The “identity” clue** | The “Hamnet Sedra” who appeared in Britain was actually William Sedra (the colour‑blind twin).
